result.execSummary:
The defendant Joseph A Herbst Jr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Probation on cases 16CF564, 15CF1440, 15CF1441 are Concurrent.
Consecutive to: If Revoked, any imposed sentence to be consecutive to other cases.

miscConds.notes: Cash bail applied to costs.  Costs paid in full.

Submit to an AODA assessment, follow through with any treatment, counseling.  No use or possession of alcohol or illegal drugs/drug paraphernalia. Comply with random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety. No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription. Valid prescriptions only with prior agent approval and to be taken only in the manner they are ordered.  Inform Agent and any treating physician of all prescriptions and sign releases.

No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged, or distributed.  Maintain employment and/or school combination.  Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by the Agent.  Provide DNA Sample if not yet already previously obtained.  
  If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Joseph A Herbst Jr

records.addlTxt: Outstanding financial obligations have been satisfied.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Joseph A Herbst in court, in custody, with Attorney Daniel P Fay.  District Attorney's Office Law Intern Shannon Tenney appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case called for sentencing hearing.  There are no corrections/modifications to the presentence investigation by either party.  State gives sentencing recommendations.  Attorney Fay makes statements regarding sentencing.  Defendant makes statements.  Court sentences the Defendant to the following:

COUNT #1:  WITHHELD SENTENCE:    Consecutive to Case #15CF1441

TERM OF PROBATION:  2 YEARS   *concurrent*

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:  
____AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
____Absolute Sobriety;  Random U.A.'s ; 
____No Use or Possession of alcohol or illegal drugs 
____No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
____Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are 
prescribed/sign releases.
____Inform Agent and any treating physician of all prescriptions and sign releases
____Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
____Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling 
____DNA sample to be provided if not yet previously done 
____No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged, or distributed.

COSTS:  $268.00  (to be paid out of cash bail posted on Case #16CF564)
